article.headline: Hartford 70, Brown 63
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Ryan Stys had 24 points and four assists as Hartford held off Brown 70-63 Sunday. Hartford (4-5) never trailed in the second half and led by as many as eight points, but Brown closed the gap to five points with under two minutes to play on Mike Martin's 3-pointer. But freshman Rich Baker answered with a 3-pointer and the Hawks held on. The lead changed hands nine time in the first half. Aaron Cook had 20 points and Charles Ford added 15 points and five assists for Hartford. Stys, Cook and Ford were the only Hartford players to score in the first half. Jason Forte led Brown (3-8) with 23 points, four rebounds and four assists. Patrick Powers had 13 points and eight rebounds for the Bears.
